template.template: Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
template.name: Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes

item.name: Host name of Zabbix agent running
Zabbix agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Zabbix agent is unreachable
trigger.description: For active agents, nodata() with agent.ping is used with {$AGENT.NODATA_TIMEOUT} as time threshold.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} is unavailable by ICMP
trigger.description: [Informações] - O equipamento deixou de responder pacotes ICMP e provavelmente está offline.

item.name: Maximum number of open file descriptors
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Configured max number of open filedescriptors is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXFILES.MIN})

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Configured max number of processes is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXPROC.MIN})

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Getting closer to process limit (over 80% used)
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:proc.num.last()}/{Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>80

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: CPU utilization in %

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Average CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.AVERAGE}% for {$CPU.UTIL.TIME})
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Critical CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for {$CPU.UTIL.TIME.CRIT})
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.HIGH}% for {$CPU.UTIL.TIME.HIGH})
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: System name
item.description: System host name.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: System local time
item.description: System local time of the host.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: System time is out of sync (diff with Zabbix server > {$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX}s)
trigger.description: The host system time is different from the Zabbix server time.

item.name: Operating system architecture
item.description: Operating system architecture of the host.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.hostname.diff()}=1 and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.hostname.strlen()}>0

item.name: Free swap space
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in percent.

item.name: Total swap space
item.description: The total space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: System description
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: System uptime
item.description: System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Operating system description has changed
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.sw.os.diff()}=1 and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.sw.os.strlen()}>0

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.hostname.diff()}=1 and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.hostname.strlen()}>0

item.name: Get /proc/diskstats
item.description: Get contents of /proc/diskstats for discovery and disk stats.

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item.name: Memory utilization %
item.description: Memory used percentage is calculated as (100-pavailable)

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Average memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.AVERAGE}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Critical memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: High memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.HIGH}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.name: Total percentage of allocated memory
item.description: pused - percentual de memória 'active' + 'wired' em relação à 'total'. https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/pt/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item.name: Total memory
item.description: Total memory in Bytes

item.name: Used memory
item.description: used - memória 'active' + 'wired'. https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/pt/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item_prototype.name: Operational status: {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface RFC2863 operational state as a string. Possible values are:"unknown", "notpresent", "down", "lowerlayerdown", "testing","dormant", "up". Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface type: {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface protocol type as a decimal value. See include/uapi/linux/if_arp.h for all possible values. Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

item.host: Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes

item_prototype.name: Disk read request avg waiting time: {#DEVNAME}
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: Disk read time (rate): {#DEVNAME}
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: Disk utilization: {#DEVNAME}
item_prototype.description: This item is the percentage of elapsed time that the selected disk drive was busy servicing read or writes requests.

item_prototype.name: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await): {#DEVNAME}
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: Disk write rate: {#DEVNAME}
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk write time (rate): {#DEVNAME}
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

item.host: Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME} - {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME} - {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Disk K8S {#FSNAME} space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.HIGH:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.HIGH:"{#FSNAME}"}.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Disk {#FSNAME} space is Average (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.AVERAGE:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.AVERAGE:"{#FSNAME}"}.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Disk {#FSNAME} space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.

item.host: Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes
Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes

graph_prototype.name: Disk space usage history on the partition: {#FSNAME}

macro.description: Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,pfree].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.AVERAGE} and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Average swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.AVERAGE}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: High swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.HIGH}% free)
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,pfree].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.HIGH} and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,pfree].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.DISASTER} and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Critical swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.DISASTER}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:proc.num.last()}/{Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>80
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Getting closer to process limit (over 80% used)

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Getting closer to process limit (over 90% used)
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:proc.num.last()}/{Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>90

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:proc.num.last()}/{Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>90
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Getting closer to process limit (over 90% used)

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Getting closer to process limit (over 95% used)
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:proc.num.last()}/{Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>95

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:proc.num.last()}/{Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>95
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Getting closer to process limit (over 95% used)

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,pfree].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.HIGH} and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: High swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.HIGH}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Critical swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.DISASTER}% free)
dependency.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,pfree].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.DISASTER} and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0

trigger.expression: {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:vm.memory.size[available].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template EN Linux Active for Kubernetes:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
{HOST.NAME}: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.AVG} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.CRIT} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.
